title: Labeling GUI not working (if config path is incorrect, GUI will not function correctly)
body:
**OS and version**
Windows 10, DLC2.0

**Describe the problem**
The labeling GUI isn't working properly when I press the LabelFrame button and select the directory, the notebook dies. Following is a traceback:

 FileNotFoundError                         Traceback (most recent call last)
D:\New folder\Dropbox (Duke Bio_Ea)\Bhandawat Lab\Umar\Week of 11-5\DeepLabCut\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\labeling_toolbox.py in browseDir(self, event)
    139             self.Close(True)
    140         dlg.Destroy()
--> 141         with open(str(self.config_file), 'r') as ymlfile:
    142             self.cfg = yaml.load(ymlfile)
    143         self.scorer = self.cfg['scorer']

FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'Digits\\Digits-Umar-2018-11-07\\config.yaml'

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
D:\New folder\Dropbox (Duke Bio_Ea)\Bhandawat Lab\Umar\Week of 11-5\DeepLabCut\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\labeling_toolbox.py in nextImage(self, event)
    219         from skimage import io
    220         self.file = 1
--> 221         MainFrame.saveEachImage(self)
    222         self.canvas.Destroy()
    223         plt.close(self.fig1)

D:\New folder\Dropbox (Duke Bio_Ea)\Bhandawat Lab\Umar\Week of 11-5\DeepLabCut\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\labeling_toolbox.py in saveEachImage(self)
    253         Saves data for each image
    254         """
--> 255         plt.close(self.fig1)
    256 
    257         for idx, bp in enumerate(self.updatedCoords):

AttributeError: 'MainFrame' object has no attribute 'fig1'

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
D:\New folder\Dropbox (Duke Bio_Ea)\Bhandawat Lab\Umar\Week of 11-5\DeepLabCut\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\labeling_toolbox.py in nextImage(self, event)
    219         from skimage import io
    220         self.file = 1
--> 221         MainFrame.saveEachImage(self)
    222         self.canvas.Destroy()
    223         plt.close(self.fig1)

D:\New folder\Dropbox (Duke Bio_Ea)\Bhandawat Lab\Umar\Week of 11-5\DeepLabCut\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\labeling_toolbox.py in saveEachImage(self)
    253         Saves data for each image
    254         """
--> 255         plt.close(self.fig1)
    256 
    257         for idx, bp in enumerate(self.updatedCoords):

AttributeError: 'MainFrame' object has no attribute 'fig1'

ERROR:tornado.application:Exception in callback functools.partial(<function wrap.<locals>.null_wrapper at 0x000002B09E945C80>)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\ua12\AppData\Local\conda\conda\envs\dlc2\lib\site-packages\tornado\ioloop.py", line 758, in _run_callback
    ret = callback()
  File "C:\Users\ua12\AppData\Local\conda\conda\envs\dlc2\lib\site-packages\tornado\stack_context.py", line 300, in null_wrapper
    return fn(*args, **kwargs)
  File "C:\Users\ua12\AppData\Local\conda\conda\envs\dlc2\lib\site-packages\ipykernel\kernelbase.py", line 306, in advance_eventloop
    eventloop(self)
  File "C:\Users\ua12\AppData\Local\conda\conda\envs\dlc2\lib\site-packages\ipykernel\eventloops.py", line 238, in loop_tk
    app.tk.createfilehandler(stream.getsockopt(zmq.FD), READABLE, notifier)
AttributeError: '_tkinter.tkapp' object has no attribute 'createfilehandler'

**Other Information**
Don't know exactly why the gui isn't working but the images aren't loading.

** Additional **
Is there backwards compatibility with version 1? I have lots of labelled data and would just like to use that instead of relabeling. Was mainly interested in the relabeling feature during incorrect training.
